How This Natural API Document Is Organized

This Natural API (Application Programming Interface) document has pages corresponding to the items in the navigation bar, described as follows.

Overview

The Overview page is the front page of this Natural API document and provides a list of all libraries with a summary for each. This page can also contain an overall description of the set of libraries.

Library

Each library has a page that contains a list of its Natural sources, with a summary for each. This page can contain the categories:
  • Library description
  • Data Definition Module
  • Global Data Area
  • Local Data Area
  • Parameter Data Area
  • Class
  • Map
  • Dialog
  • Subroutine
  • Subprogram
  • Function
  • Adapter
  • Helproutine
  • Program

Natural Source

Each source has its own separate page. Each of these pages has two sections consisting of a description and detailed member descriptions:
  • Source description
  • Data Definition Modules
  • Independent Variables
  • Global Using
  • Object Data Areas
  • Context Variables

Each summary entry contains the first sentence from the detailed description for that item. The detailed descriptions are in the order they appear in the source code. This preserves the logical groupings established by the programmer.

Deprecated API

The Deprecated API page lists all of the sources that have been deprecated. A deprecated API is not recommended for use, generally due to improvements, and a replacement API is usually given. Deprecated APIs may be removed in future implementations.

Index

The Index contains an alphabetic list of all relevant natural sources.

Prev/Next

These links take you to the next or previous sources, libraries, or related page.

Frames/No Frames

These links show and hide the HTML frames. All pages are available with or without frames.

This help file applies to Natural API documentation generated using the standard template.
